content: New Era of Opportunity for Israel and the Palestinians

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div table tbody tr td span span
html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div table tbody tr td span span
html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div table tbody tr td span em span
html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div a span
html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div a span
html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div a span
html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div span table tbody tr td span
html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div span font span
content: A historic breakthrough that might lead to an end of the bloodshed is possible, says Fawaz Gerges, professor of Middle Eastern and international affairs at Sarah Lawrence College in New York.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: Mr. Gerges says, “this is the beginning of a highly complex journey.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: It is very messy, risky and extremely unpredictable.”

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: Since the breakdown of talks at Camp David four years ago, the conflict has left more than three thousand Palestinians and over one thousand Israelis dead.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: But with new Palestinian leadership emerging after the death of Yasser Arafat and a second term for U.S. President Bush, Mr. Gerges and many other analysts believe this is a watershed moment.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: In an unusual overture, Israeli Prime Minister Ariel Sharon said he is ready to coordinate a

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div table tbody tr td span
content: Mahmoud Abbas is the frontrunner in the Palestinian presidential race

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div font span
content: pullout from the Gaza Strip with a future Palestinian government and foresees what he calls possible 'years of peace.'

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div font span
content: Most analysts agree that recent statements by the Palestinian presidential frontrunner Mahmoud Abbas, reflect a change in tone on the part of the Palestinian Authority.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div font span
content: Mr. Abbas said the armed uprising against Israel was a mistake, and that any resistance against Israeli occupation should be through non-violent means.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: However, Mr. Abbas's position will need to be reinforced if he is to confront militant groups that attack Israelis, according to Steve Yetiv, professor of political science at Old Dominion University in Virginia.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: Mr. Yetiv says, “I think it is somewhat pointless to move ahead with a serious peace process until Mr. Abbas, who appears to be the leader in the January 9th elections, is strengthened.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: Mr. Abbas is not going to crack down on extremists if he does not have strength, and the Israelis who have fallen out of the peace process because of insecurity are not going to trust Mr. Abbas unless he is stronger.”

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div table tbody tr td span
html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div font span
content: Mr. Yetiv adds that Israel can make some concessions that would fortify Mr. Abbas.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div font span
content: Paul Scham, an Israeli-Arab scholar at the Middle East Institute in Washington, agrees, saying Israel should no longer require that all terrorist attacks stop before it comes to the negotiating table with the Palestinians.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: “The fact is that these attacks will probably continue,” says Mr. Scham.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: “To demand absolute quiet from the Palestinians means that nothing will go anywhere.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: The Israeli government and the Israeli people recognize that to suspend everything at that point would empower the terrorists.”

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: With the possibility of continuing bloodshed on both sides not being ruled out, Sarah Lawrence College's Fawaz Gerges says the best chance for sustained peace in the Middle East rests on decisive U.S. presidential leadership.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: “The intervention of the United States is crucial,” says Mr. Gerges, “ not only to enable the

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div table tbody tr td span
content: Palestinians will go to the polls throughout 2005 to vote for new leadership

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div font span
content: emerging Palestinian leadership to rebuild their political and security institutions, but also to impress on the Israeli interest that it is in their own vital interest that a settlement based on two viable states living side by side is achieved.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div font span
content: Most importantly, after the elections, the United States must actively engage in peace making.”

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: Mr. Gerges notes the United States took a hands-off approach to the conflict in the last couple of years.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: U.S. officials described the late Palestinian President Yasser Arafat as an obstacle to peace, accusing him of backing militant attacks against Israel.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: But with the election of new Palestinian leadership, President Bush says he will make resolving the Middle East conflict a top priority, reiterating his goal of establishing a Palestinian state alongside Israel.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: The United States is donating about $25,000,000 to help the Palestinian Authority carry out the January elections.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: The European Union and the international community at large have also offered millions of dollars in aid, and will be sending international observers to monitor the elections.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: Old Dominion University's Steve Yetiv says other countries, particularly neighboring Arab states, should go even further to support Mahmoud Abbas and the peace process.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: He says recent gestures by Egypt are positive developments.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: Mr. Yetiv says, “they did not react negatively to the Israeli idea of withdrawing from Gaza and they seem to be willing to play a caretaker role after the withdrawal.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: They are supportive of Abbas though he is generally more moderate than the other key actors on the Palestinian scene.”

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: As a result, many observers are cautiously optimistic, even though they concede that some extreme elements on both sides do not want peace.

tag: html body text div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td div div div p span font span
content: But with substantial U.S. involvement and world support, they say peace in the Middle East is possible in 2005.
